intro: Odontophyllum rusbyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in a variety of colors, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are usually velvety and dark green, often with a waxy texture. Odontophyllum rusbyi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
